Article.Abstract: A synthetic peptide approach has been used to identify the epitopes recognized by clonal and polyclonal human T cells reactive to the recombinant mycobacterial 65-kDa protein Ag. Three of the four epitopes identified were recognized as cross-reactive between Mycobacterium tuberculosis and Mycobacterium leprae, although their amino acid sequence in two of three cases was not identical. The peptide (231-245) defining an epitope recognized as specific to the M. tuberculosis complex contains two substitutions compared with the homologous M. leprae region of which one or both are critical to T cell recognition. The reactive T cell clones showed helper/inducer phenotype (CD4+, CD8-), and secrete IL-2, granulocyte-macrophage-CSF, and IFN-gamma upon Ag stimulation. The same clones display cytotoxicity against macrophages pulsed with the relevant peptides or mycobacteria.
Article.ArticleTitle: Epitopes of the Mycobacterium tuberculosis 65-kilodalton protein antigen as recognized by human T cells.
Article.Affiliations: Laboratory for Immunology, Norwegian Radium Hospital, Oslo.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Antigens, Bacterial(isolation & purification); Clone Cells(immunology; metabolism); Epitopes(isolation & purification); Humans; Lymphocyte Activation; Lymphokines(biosynthesis); Molecular Sequence Data; Molecular Weight; Mycobacterium tuberculosis(immunology); Peptide Fragments(immunology); Peptide Mapping; T-Lymphocytes(immunology; metabolism)
Article.Comments: Data originally imported from the HLA Ligand Database (http://hlaligand.ouhsc.edu/)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This protein was referred to in the manuscript as a 65-kDa antigen. It is also identified as the 60 kDa chaperonin 2, Protein Cpn60 2 or groEL protein 2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The A7JM clone did not respond to the flanking and overlapping peptides (201-215; 219-233) of the epitope 211-225, while a T cell line derived form the same individual by stimulation with BCG and M.tuberculosis 65K-Da Ag had a broader pattern of reactivity.
he effector in this assay is a polyclonal T-cell population obtained from a donor vaccinated with killed M.leprae and restimulated in vitro with M. bovis BCG and M. tuberculosis 65-kDa protein.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope did not inhibid antigen presentation of the peptide M.TB231-245 (LLPLLEKVIGAGKPL).
